Harry Styles puts $8 million LA bachelor pad up for sale and reveals secret love for cow print and home spin classes

The One Direction star's quirky interior design is revealed throughout the plush three-bedroom home

View 13 Images (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

Harry Styles has put his $8 million Hollywood Hills bachelor pad up for sale.

‌



The 4,401 square-foot home is "perched" just above Los Angeles' famed Sunset Strip.

‌



The gated three-bedroom, five-bathroom home boasts "epic" views of downtown and the ocean, through floor-to-ceiling windows.

‌



Littered throughout the 14-room house are tell-tale signs of 24-year-old Harry's quirky style.

View 13 Images The master bedroom offers spectacular views of LA (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

View 13 Images There's an impressive terrace (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

‌



And he clearly has a secret penchant for cow print as the entranceway features a cow hide rug - and matching chairs can be found in one of the three bedrooms.

The house - which sits on a 25 acre lot - also has a gym with a bright yellow spin bike suggesting Harry likes to workout in the comfort of his own home.

The impressive house was originally built in 1963 and features a breakfast room, living room, master bedroom, large patio, home theater and two other bedrooms.

‌



View 13 Images Harry loves cow print (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

View 13 Images He has a home gym (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

View 13 Images One of the bedrooms has cow print too (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

‌



View 13 Images The house was built in the 1960s (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

View 13 Images There's a pool (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

There's also a fire place, central heating and air conditioning, keeping the pad cool and hot at all the right times.

‌



The home features a hot tub, spa and pool.

Additionally, the house has green energy technology.

View 13 Images A score board decorates the patio (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

‌



View 13 Images The bathroom is plush (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

View 13 Images There's three bedrooms in total (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

View 13 Images There's bright modern art in the kitchen (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

‌



View 13 Images Harry owned the house for two years (Image: Hilton & Hyland)

The modern home also comes with a laundry room, alarm system and hardwood flooring.

To keep prying eyes away, the house is up a long drive to ensure complete privacy.

Article continues below

There's a gated two-car garage and other parking spaces for cars.

Harry purchased the house for $6,870,000 in January 2016, so he's had it for two years.
